Entry.Val: Rat's Nest
Your Grandma asked you to clear out her cellar of some pesky rodents.
A house was destroyed in a shattering.

The family that lived there was taken by the light and they act really strangely now. These light attacks are becoming more frequent int he land, you must keep your eyes open for an opportunity to investigate this.
The gods visited your dreams.
Whether willingly or by force, you were marked as chosen and told you will one day need to face a great task for the gods.
Bandits have stolen your goods.
You managed to track the bandits to their lair, you can take revenge and reclaim your goods.
The bastards have escaped with your stuff, but maybe you will catch up to them with some luck.
A hahalek demon was holding your goods.
The demon spoke of light hurting it and so forcing even a house demon to work for the bandits. The lightbringers are clearly disturbing the balance in the land.
You killed the pesky demon, but it is odd why a house demon would work for bandits. Demons seem to be acting strange these days.
You found an eerily empty swamp with only one odd-looking toad left.
The toad asked to be taken to a witch's hut nearby. It gave you directions so you should see the hut if you look for it.
You killed the weird toad.
You left the swamp.
You found the witch's hut and it seems to be a baba yaga. She asked for the toad.

The toad looked like a cmuch demon, but was actually a cursed vodnik. The 'prince' was grateful for his release. He told you of demons being burned by the light that came from the ground. Some died, some became changed. This light is clearly poisoning the land.

You failed to undo the cmuch's curse, but the yaga, she mentioned something about the swamp's demons disappearing after a shattering and a light appearing. Likely another case of the lightbringers meddling.
You attacked the baba yaga and so you did not get much information from her or the cmuch. Keep an eye out for more trails of the lightbringers activities
You left the toad with the yaga, she mentioned something about the swamp's demons disappearing after a shattering and a light appearing. Likely another case of the lightbringers meddling.
You attacked the vodnik and so you did not get much information from him or the yaga. Keep an eye out for more trails of the lightbringers activities.
You were assaulted by light-wisps.

Eventually the wisps flicker away towards the sun and disappear.You see burnt carcasses of bugs and small critters around you, but you also spot a small pack of oddly paired beings moving away in unison, as if trying to follow the wisps. This light-scourge needs to be stopped. keep a lookout for a way.
You are ambushed by the scoundrels that took your goods earlier.

You defeated the bandits and reclaimed your goods. The scoundrels spoke of the earth shattering their homes and light taking their folk driving them to banditry. This light-scourge needs to be stopped. keep a lookout for a way.

They defeat you but let you go. The scoundrels spoke of the earth shattering their homes and light taking their folk driving them to banditry. This light-scourge needs to be stopped. keep a lookout for a way.
You came across an odd man, calling himself an Alchemist.

You kill the man and loot his strange table. Among other things, you find a map with a place distinctly marked: 'Stupid bandits unable to grasp the importance of their cave - need to get in here before all shatters!'

You tried but failed to kill the Alchemist, but he let you live and proved to be an agent of the divine will like you. He told you of a red cave that may hold the secret to the lightbringer scourge. But in order to get into the cave, you need to deal with the Red Ridge Bandits, who set up camp near the cave's entrance. The bandit lair should appear on your map.

The Alchemist proved to be an agent of the divine will also, and he told you of a red cave that may hold the secret to the lightbringer scourge. But in order to get into the cave, you need to deal with the Red Ridge Bandits, who set up camp near the cave's entrance. The bandit lair should appear on your map.
You found the lair of the Red Ridge Bandits.
You destroyed the bandits and thus the entrance to the Red Cave stands open for you. The Alchemist agreed to meet you inside when you are ready.

You tried to kill the bandits but they defeated you and so there is little chance of getting into the cave that way. The Alchemist recommended going to a scavenger camp nearby to seek their aid in defeating the bandits.

The bandits are willing to let you into the Red Cave, but only if you deal with some scavengers that are bothering them, or a pesky demon living in an old mine. Both locations should appear on your map now.

The bandits are willing to let you into the Red Cave, but only if you deal with some scavengers that are bothering them, or a baba yaga living in a hut nearby. Both locations should appear on your map now.

You sneak into the bandit camp and manage to rescue the scavenger child, along with a few others.They are unusually reluctant to be rescued, so they make a real ruckus and you are forced to run fast before the bandits catch you. There's little chance of them being friendly now, but you can go back to the scavengers and report your success.
The bandits sold you the scavenger child. Now you can go back to the scavengers and report your success.
The Red Ridge bandits allowed you access to the Red Cave as agreed. The Alchemist will meet you at the cave when you're ready.
After making the deal with the scavengers, you destroyed the bandits. To get to the Red Cave return to the scavengers and give them their child back.
You arrived at the scavenger settlement that is at odds with the Red Ridge bandits.
You agreed to pretend you killed the scavengers, to either poison the bandits or steal back the scavenger child. Go back to the Red Ridge bandit camp and lie to them.
You failed to convince the scavengers to help you out, so they chase you away. You can try killing them when you're better prepared.
You failed to kill the scavengers, so they chase you away. You can try killing them when you're better prepared.
You killed the scavengers, time to report back to the bandits so you may gain access to the Red Cave.
You convinced the scavengers to leave, time to report back to the bandits so you may gain access to the Red Cave.
The scavengers were not eager to help you in any way, killing the bandits seems like the only way to get into the Red Cave now.
The scavengers are happy with your results and so they help you get into the Red Cave. The Alchemist will likely await you at the entrance when you're ready.
You see the remains of a scavenger settlement, it is destroyed. perhaps the bandits decided to deal with them after all.
You found the witch hut the bandits wanted destroyed.
Your actions failed. The house shifts and shakes and you feel it becoming very hostile towards you. You can try to attack later, or find another path.
You succeeded to deal with the witch so you can go back to the bandits and report your success.
The witch convinced you not to kill her, instead she will stay low for a time, so you can try and lie to the bandits and say you did kill her.
But you decided to leave for now.
The witch was happy to learn of your success and wished you well. She and her hut have moved away from this place.
You found the demon occupied mine the bandits wanted cleared.
But you decided to leave for now.
The demons were happy to learn of your success and wished you well.
You made a deal with the demon to go back to the bandits, lie about killing the demons and then call upon the demons with a secret word so that they can aid you in killing the Red Ridgers.
The demons offered a deal, where they will help you to kill the bandits. You said you will consider it.
The demons offered to hide, so that you may lie to the bandits and say you killed them. Go back to the bandit camp.
You killed the demons as asked. Time to report back to the bandits.
The demons beat you badly and forced you to run away. You can try again, or try another path.
You failed to deal with the demons. You can try again, or try another path.
You arrived at the Red Cave, where the Alchemist awaits.
You tried to get through the barrier, but failed. You need to come back stronger in brawn or magic to try again.

You have entered deeper into the cave, but it holds more mysteries and you need aid to unravel them. You can either choose to rescue an old dwarf from a prison, a tough, but straight forward path. Or, you can look for aid with other factions, the orcs, goblins, dwarves or elves. Seek any of their larger villages and make sure you are friendly before approaching them.
You arrived at the dungeon where the dwarven prisoner is held.

You failed to rescue the dwarf and were forced to leave. Try again, or perhaps look for other paths, the elves, dwarves, goblins or orcs may have some answers for you. Maybe search for their villages.
You rescued the grandmaster, time to return to the Red Cave.
You come to where the dwarven prisoner was supposed to be held, but you find the earth parted and only rabble where the entrance once was.
You returned to the Red Cave after rescuing the grandmaster dwarf.
The Alchemist sent you to find a druid-tree and retrieve its blood so that a new heart may be forged and stabilise the earth.
You find the druid-tree in an old grove.
The druid-tree agreed to sacrifice their own life for your cause. You have the blood so you can return to the Red Cave.
You were tasked with finding a dying druid-tree and end their misery. This way you will also achieve your goal. Search for the forest where the tree is trapped.
The druid-tree did not agree to aid you. You must either force it, or try another path altogether.
You killed the druid-tree and got theblood. Time to return to the Red Cave.
The forest is quiet and ordinary. You walk and walk but do not find traces of the druid-tree anywhere.
You find the place where a dying druid-tree is supposed to be held.
You failed to retrieve the druid-tree's blood. Try again later, or try another path amongst the other factions.
You retrieved the blood of the druid-tree, return to the Red Cave.
But you find nothing of interest here.
You were attacked by lightbringers who wanted to take away the druid blood.
After the fight, you were approached by a group of hooded figures. You decided to move away and do not engage.

You were told that they were the cult of Nyia and that they were the ones led astray and used to destroy the earth-heart that held the ground together. They recognise your mission and wish you well on your path.
You were defeated and the blood stolen! Try to track them down.
You catch the lightbringers who took the druid-blood and one of your people
You retrieve the stolen blood, so you can now go back to the Red Cave.
You decided not to approach for now.
You were badly beaten and forced to flee. You must try again if you want to retrieve the druid blood.
You enter the ancient, underground chamber where four dwarven statues stand guard over the entrance to the heart-chamber.
You defeated the guardians and they bid you to right their wrongs and restore balance. Go back to the Red Cave to complete the stone heart.
You were defeated by the guardians and they bid you return when you are ready.
You finally enter the heart chamber where the light-beast dwells and seeks to escape into the world.
You have defeated the light-zmey! It will take time for Thea to fully absorb the changes your decisions brought, but your task as chosen is done. For now...
The light-zmey defeats you. Return when you are ready to face them again.
You track down a group of mroki. Perhaps you can harvest their hearts for the necromancer.
You defeated the mroki. You can now head to the red cave and meet the necromancer and find your way into the chamber where the light-beast awaits.
The mroki defeated you, but perhaps you can try to track them down again.
The elven mage has confronted you and demands you follow her path.
You agreed to stay on her side and go straight to the zmey cave, and not the Alchemist.
You decided you do not want to follow her path and so you defeated the elf in combat. Seek out another path to end the light-zmey.
You decided you do not want to follow her path and so you tried to kill the mage. She defeated you but allowed you to live. Seek out another path to end the light-zmey.
You visited the Aphaclans and asked for aid in defeating the light-beast.
The orcs were unable to aid you in discovering more about the Red Cave, but they recommended you seek out an orc necromancer, who is known to meddle in many mysteries.
You visited the Spirit Talkers and asked for aid in defeating the light-beast.
The goblins were unable to aid you in discovering more about the Red Cave, but they recommended you seek out an orc necromancer, who is known to meddle in many mysteries.
You visited the necromancer in his tower.

He told you of his design to release the power of darkness, so it may destroy light. You agreed to follow his path. Hunt down some mroki, in the lands of darkness or the volcanic wastelands. Afterwards, meet the necromancer at the cave to defeat the light-beast.
He told you of his design to release the power of darkness, so it may destroy light. You refused to follow his path, and so you must now find another way.
You sought the aid of the dwarves in the fight against the lightbringers.

The Earthbound admitted their shame in failing their duty and allowing the destruction of the earth-heart. They will forge a new heart rune, but you need to go seek out the dziad mroz. The ancient demon dwells in the ice plains.
You found the dziad mroz in his domain of the ice plains.
The ancient demon agreed to hand over the ice drop that you need for the dwarves. You can now return to the cave to fight the light-beast.
You killed the dziad mroz, so you now need to seek another way to deal with the light-beast.
You failed to obtain the ice heart from the dziad mroz, so you now need to seek another way to deal with the light-beast.
You approached the Woodlandkin in search for answers and aid with the lightbringer threat.

A young elven druid, Nai-ysir, told you of how the council is too slow to act. But she also said she knows of an elf mage that may be the cause of all this, thus capturing her and bringing her before the council may secure their aid. Go seek out the rouge mage.
You found the hideout of Ail'yleth, the rogue elven mage.
Ail'yleth tried to sway you to her side, claiming it is time for light to rule. You agreed to follow her path and go seek out a hidden entrance into the heart chamber where the light beast resides.

Ail'yleth tried to sway you to her side, claiming it is time for light to rule. You did not agree, and instead you convinced her balance needs to be served. The mage will join you at the old prison and held rescue the dwarven grandmaster.
Ail'yleth tried to sway you to her side, claiming it is time for light to rule. You refused to listen to her madness and captured her to be taken to back to the elves.
Ail'yleth tried to sway you to her side, claiming it is time for light to rule. You refused her madness, but also failed to capture her. You must seek another way to destroy the light.
You returned the elf mage to the council and they agreed to aid you in destroying the light-beast. The envoy will meet you back at the Red Cave.
You returned the elf mage to the council but they did not agree to aid you. Nai-ysir was angry and decided to join you, but you must now find another way to deal with the light.
You found the entrance to the heart chamber just as Ail'yleth directed you.
The mage joins you and guides you to face some dwarven guardians.
You have defeated the dwarven guardians and aided the light-zmey so that one day, light will rule Thea. For better or worse, you have completed your task.
The dwarven guardians have defeated you, return when you are better prepared.
You entered the heart chamber to face the dwarven guards and aid the light-zmey.
Theodore, a former house demon, now divine messenger, visited you.

He laid out some of the basic rules to survive in this world. His final words were: 'I may pop up now and again to tell you of things, but for now, you must take your first steps into this hostile land. Remember to check for resources on the map for Gathering, set up camp for Craft and Cooking, and check your Inventory to make sure you are well equipped. Here have some wood, so you may heal when camping. My advice is to explore, learn the ropes, and only then decide on a settlement.'
Theodore praised you on your progress with the lightbringers and awarded you a second cosmic seed.
Theodore has once again visited you.
The messenger asked you to find a Slavyan village where an ex-chosen needs to be taught a lesson. you should find the village on your map.
Theodore showed up to give you some more advice.
You were tasked with gathering or cooking some more food, as this is a crucial skill in surviving Thea. He also reminded you that the death of the chosen will mean the end for all.
Theodore showed up again with yet another task.
He was happy with the food and he asked you to visit an old hut nearby.
Theodore showed up again after your meeting with the witch.
He praised you for defeating the hag and said you will make a good chosen. He mentioned he will be back for a final, small task before you are ready for the big stuff.
He was worried you did not do well, but said you have time to get better. He mentioned he will be back for a final, small task before you are ready for the big stuff.
You found the village where Theodore sent you.
The villagers gave you the location of Zbigniev, the fallen chosen, but all they could say was 'go that way'. So you must search for him nearby.

You destroyed the village and Theodore seems pleased with the firm message this sends to any other non-believers. He said it is time for him to disappear, he told you to keep an eye out for the lightbringers, and that in time, you find clues to your next task.
You attacked the villagers but failed, you must return when you're better prepared.
You found Zbigniev, the fallen chosen who seemed very angry with the gods.

You dealt with the heretic and Theodore appeared to speak to you. He said it is time for him to disappear, he told you to keep an eye out for the lightbringers, and that in time, you will find clues to your next task.
Divine path
A crow visited you and spoke of your chosen path.
The bird measured your worth as chosen so far and said that you must unlock your true potential if you are to truly aid the gods. You chose to follow one of your divine domains to discover more.
You came to the place where the crow sent you to unlock your true potential as chosen.
But you cannot proceed without the chosen being present.

The placed proved to be the fallen temple of Jarillo, a forgotten god. He spoke to you of Perun, the father of the pantheon, and he urged you to discover what become of the god of thunder, so that your own divine path may become clearer. You are to go to the ice lands, there you will find your next task.

The placed proved to be one of the divine roots of the old goddess Mokosh. Some lightbringers were assaulting the root, and so you had to deal with them. When you touched the root, you knew you must seek out another such place and discover the truth of Mokosh's fate so that your own divine path may become clearer. You are to go to the Ancient Forest; there you will find your next task.

It turned out you interrupted a sabbath of witches, loyal to the old god and father of human witchcraft, Veles. You must seek out the resting place of Veles and discover the truth of his fate so that your own divine path may become clearer. You are to go to the Ancient Forest; there you will find your next task.

The placed proved to be the resting place of the old god, Veles, and as such, one of the gates to the underworlds guarded by a zmey. When you spoke to the zmey he told you that you must now seek out and release your own god to complete your journey as chosen. Find Marovit's trail in the lands of darkness.

The placed proved to be the resting place of the old god, Veles, and as such, one of the gates to the underworlds guarded by a zmey. When you spoke to the zmey he told you that you must now seek out and release your own god to complete your journey as chosen. Find Zorya's trail in the volcanic lands.

The placed proved to be the resting place of the old god, Veles, and as such, one of the gates to the underworlds guarded by a zmey. When you spoke to the zmey he told you that you must now seek out and release your own god to complete your journey as chosen. Find Nyia's trail in the lands of darkness or Metal.

The placed proved to be the resting place of the old god, Veles, and as such, one of the gates to the underworlds guarded by a zmey. When you spoke to the zmey he told you that you must now seek out and release your own god to complete your journey as chosen. Find Horz's trail in the volcanic lands.

The placed proved to be the resting place of the old god, Veles, and as such, one of the gates to the underworlds guarded by a zmey. When you spoke to the zmey he told you that you must now seek out and release your own god to complete your journey as chosen. Find Lada's trail in the lands of the Ancient Forest or the ice plains.
The placed proved to be the resting place of the old god, Veles, and as such, one of the gates to the underworlds guarded by a zmey. Alas, you were defeated in battle, so must return better prepared.
You found the divine location where your chosen's path may continue.
The placed proved to be one of the divine roots of the old goddess Mokosh. Some lightbringers were assaulting the root and you were defeated by them. Return when you are ready for the challenge.
You found the rod of Perun, but failed to release it. You must return when you are better prepared.

You found the rod of Perun and released it from the giant's grasp. The voice of the old god spoke to you and commanded you go seek out your own god's fate now, to complete your journey. Find Zorya's trail in the volcanic lands.

You found the rod of Perun and released it from the giant's grasp. The voice of the old god spoke to you and commanded you go seek out your own god's fate now, to complete your journey. Find Triglav's trail in the volcanic lands.

You found the rod of Perun and released it from the giant's grasp. The voice of the old god spoke to you and commanded you go seek out your own god's fate now, to complete your journey. Find Svarog's trail in the lands of Metal.

You found the rod of Perun and released it from the giant's grasp. The voice of the old god spoke to you and commanded you go seek out your own god's fate now, to complete your journey. Find Stribog's trail while sailing the seas.
You found another root of a Mokosh tree, but failed to interact with it properly. You must return when you are better prepared.
You found another root of a Mokosh tree, but decided to attack its keeper and destroy it. The divine path is now closed to you.

You found another root of a Mokosh tree and you offered appropriate tribute so that its divine power blessed you. Through the leshy, the earth-mother urged you to seek out your own god now and thus end your journey as chosen. Find Dzievanna's trail in the lands of the Ancient Forest.

You found another root of a Mokosh tree and you offered appropriate tribute so that its divine power blessed you. Through the leshy, the earth-mother urged you to seek out your own god now and thus end your journey as chosen. Find Horz's trail in the volcanic lands.

You found another root of a Mokosh tree and you offered appropriate tribute so that its divine power blessed you. Through the leshy, the earth-mother urged you to seek out your own god now and thus end your journey as chosen. Find Triglav's trail in the volcanic lands.

You found another root of a Mokosh tree and you offered appropriate tribute so that its divine power blessed you. Through the leshy, the earth-mother urged you to seek out your own god now and thus end your journey as chosen. Find Nyia's trail in the lands of Darkness or Metal.

You found another root of a Mokosh tree and you offered appropriate tribute so that its divine power blessed you. Through the leshy, the earth-mother urged you to seek out your own god now and thus end your journey as chosen. Find Lada's trail in the lands of the Ancient Forest or the ice plains.

You found another root of a Mokosh tree and you offered appropriate tribute so that its divine power blessed you. Through the leshy, the earth-mother urged you to seek out your own god now and thus end your journey as chosen. Find Stribog's trail while sailing the seas.
You have followed the divine path and found Marovit's avatar.
You have completed your divine path of the chosen. As reward, your children will now have a chance to grow stronger, in accordance to the domain you chose.
You have completed your divine path of the chosen. As reward, your children will now have a chance to grow up into an unusual creature, blessed by your god.
You have followed the divine path and found Svarog's avatar.
You were violent and so disrespectful to your Lady's path. She deemed you unworthy. Your divine path has ended, you can only hope you will redeem yourself in Her eyes one day.
You have followed the divine path and found Lada's avatar.
You have followed the divine path and found Lada's avatar.
You destroyed nature's children for no reason and thus disrespected you goddess. She deemed you unworthy. Your divine path has ended, you can only hope you will redeem yourself in Her eyes one day.
You have followed the divine path and found Horz's avatar.

You attack the night children and then lost, showing only weakness. You are not the pack leader Horz hoped for and so this is where your chosen's path ended. You can only hope you will show your worth through all your actions from now on...
You have followed the divine path and found Stribog's avatar.
You have followed the divine path and found Triglav's avatar.
You have followed the divine path and found Zorya's avatar.

You have failed to unchain your goddess' essence. You do still feel your connection to Zorya, she is not gone, but you also know you have failed your final task and will not receive any last blessings.
You have followed the divine path and found Nyia's avatar.
You know that you have failed your goddess and you will have to prove your worth with what gifts you already received on this journey.
The Smith's Legacy
You notice an interesting building nearby.
The place is secluded, but there is smoke coming out and the sounds of a smithy.
You found the forge of Bohdan, the dwarf.

Bohdan asked you to track down his two wayward granddaughters who have run away. He is too old to do it himself and promises a good reward. There are two possible spots on your map where the girls could be.
You killed Bohdan and his troll and you loot the place.
You attacked Bohdan, but he and his troll friend beat you badly and chase you away.
You brought the bad news to Bohdan and he was not happy with you. He told you to leave before he sends his troll friend after you.
You dealt with Bohdan's unruly granddaughters and he was very grateful.
You found the pond where Bohdan's granddaughters may be.
You found the girls and made sure they go back to Bohdan. Go back to the smithy for your reward.
There were some rusalka trying to entrance you, but no sign of the girls. Check the other location.
There were some rusalka trying to entrance you.
You found the girls and supported their decision to stay and become rusalka by drowning some children. Return to the smithy to tell Bohdan of his granddaughters decision.
You found the cave where Bohdan's granddaughters may be.
You managed to get the girls out before some angry trolls killed them. Go back to Bohdan for your reward.
You managed to get one of the girls out before some angry trolls killed them both. Go back to Bohdan for your reward.
You found the cave, but no sign of the girls. Check the second location.
You found the cave, but no sign of the girls as you already dealt with them.
Kurv Game
You were visited by a skshack, Leopold.

The house demon begged for your help else he may be forced to steal from you again. He asked for you to gain entrance into a demon game and win it for him. To do so, you must search for one of his demon friends first and gain their help.
You killed Leopold; he should bother you no more.
You tried to kill it, but you failed. The very surprised house demon escaped.
A hochlick came to you offering a deal.
The hochlick wanted you to kill Leopold the next time he appears, in exchange they will offer a reward. You agreed.
The hochlick wanted you to kill Leopold the next time he appears, in exchange they will offer a reward. You declined.
The hochlick wanted you to kill Leopold the next time he appears, in exchange they will offer a reward. You killed the hochlick.
You killed Leopold and got your reward from the hohlick.
You failed to kill Leopold, he run off and asked you to play the demon game for him anyway. If you visited the dola or cmuch, you will soon find the entrance to the game.
You did not kill Leopold like the hohlick asked, so you still need to play the demon game. If you visited the dola or cmuch, you will soon find the entrance to the game.

You agreed to sell Leopold into servitude after you win the demon game. In exchange the hochlick will offer a reward. So you must now seek out the game. If you visited the dola or cmuch, you will soon find the entrance to the game.
The hochlick, Frix, came to you after the game.
You were rewarded for your service.
Leopold visited you after the Kurv Game fiasco.
He said the game was suspended because the demons were shaken by your violent outburst. He left you a thank you gift before moving on.
You entered the Kurv Game.
You killed all the demons, but Leopold seemed very ungrateful and simply run off saying humans are bloody. Still, no more thieving from him.
You tried to kill the demons, but failed badly. You're not sure what happens now.
You won the game and asked for Leopold's freedom. No more thievery and one happy skshack.
You won the game but condemned Leopold to servitude. After all the little bastard stole from you.
You lost the game and so condemned Leopold to further servitude. But it seems you will no longer be bothered by the game, so there's that...
You found the swamp where Leopold's cmuch friend lives.
The demon greed to help, so you must now wait until a doorway into the game appears to you.
You killed the cmuch, so not much chance for his help now... Perhaps Leopold will appear again and offer another option.
You found the house where Leopold's dola friend lives.
You failed to get the dola's help. Perhaps Leopold will appear again and offer another option.
You trusted a demon to aid you, but they tricked you instead and had Leopold condemned to servitude. But the skshack did exlude you from the game at least.
You have discovered the main settlement of the Alphaclans

The orcs are traditionally a nomadic, clan-based society, rules by clan matriarchs. The alpha matriarch is in charge of all the clans, and it she who holds power in the settled orc villages. Orcs despise cowardice, so think twice before you choose to surrender in their presence. Orcs will not typically trade for bone or leather as they usually have it in abundance. When you become friends, you may be able to recruit an orc via the fighting pits. To gain friendship, you can try doing tasks for the Alphas when they are available.
You have come across an Alphaclans band. This may mean their settlement lies nearby.
You have discovered the main settlement of the Slavyans

The Slavyans are the largest, stable community of humans who like you, worship the Cosmic Tree Pantheon. Some of your own folk have likely come from a Slavyan village before they were thrown into the path of the chosen and forced to forge their own path. Slavyans accept all trade goods, and once friendly, you will be able to recruit up to two humans from the tavern.
You have come across a Slavyan group. This may mean their settlement lies nearby.
You have discovered the main settlement of the Scavengers

They are the second largest human community, but they are not followers of the pantheon. As the story goes, Scavengers were folk who displeased the gods and thus never received their protection during the days of Darkness. As such, they became wilder, often ridden with disease and madness. These days they are able to form more controlled societies and are known for slave trade across the land. You may be able to acquire some slaves from them, or even sell your own people.
The Glass King
You found the ruins of an old city, covered in ice so clear that it looks almost like glass.
The glass king asked you to help him break a curse by retrieving his beautiful face from a creature that now wears it. The location was marked on your map.
But you were not interested in helping him and left.
You killed the glass king.
You were defeated by the glass king and chased away from his land.

Within, there was a demon-child with the face attached to their body. You convinced the glass king to face the demon child you found, as you suspect it is his own son. The king listened and asked you to come back to him for your reward.
You found the place where the glass king sent you for his face.

Within, there was a demon-child with the face attached to their body. You failed to convince the glass king to face this child, as his own son, and the king decided not to give you any rewards. You left the place.
Within, there was a demon-child with the face attached to their body. You killed the child, and yet the curse remained so the king did not offer any rewards.
You were defeated and get no reward.
You killed the demon-child and carried their body back to the glass king. But upon seeing the body the king wept and exclaimed this was his son. The city turned black and you had to flee.
You return to the ruins of an old city, covered in ice so clear that it looks almost like glass.
The king asked you to stab him through his heart, so that his son may be released from the curse at last. You agreed.
The king asked you to stab him through his heart, so that his son may be released from the curse at last. You declined and left the place.
Fli Catapult
You found the construction site of the Fli Catapult
One of the goblin developers is known to work around the clock, so the others asked you to get a special brew for him.
A group of devoted goblin developers are constructing a complex machine called the Fli Catapult. You were not interested in helping out so you left.
A group of devoted goblin developers are constructing a complex machine called the Fli Catapult. You stole some of their stuff and run away with it.
A group of devoted goblin developers are constructing a complex machine called the Fli Catapult. You were not friendly and so you were made to leave.
A group of devoted goblin developers are constructing a complex machine called the Fli Catapult. You killed them and looted the site.
One of the Fli Catapult goblins approached you.
Avix told you the others have moved to a new, secret, location. She thanked you for the potions and left a reward.
You find the cave where you were told to look for a shaman that can give you a potion for the goblin, Khax.
You paid the price the shaman asked for and he promised to deliver the potions to the goblins. Try looking for the Fli Catapult again to get your reward.
You decided the price was too high and abandoned the task.
Vanero, the spider silk and robe trader offered his wares to you.
He moved away after you concluded your business.
You killed him and looted his wares.
You tried to kill him but you were defeated and had to pay for your attack.
You met a young girl, Suri.
She asked you to avenge her family and you agreed to help her. She said she will lead you to where the murderers are.
She asked you to avenge her family but it turned out you already killed the murderers - they were the robe traders. Suri gave you a reward and left.
She asked you to avenge her family but you were not interested and left.
Led by Suri, you tracked down her family's murderers and it turned out it was Vanero, the trader.
You killed Vanero and Suri was very grateful you took her side despite her beast nature.
You killed Suri and Vanero was grateful you stood with humans.
You decided this was none of your business and left.
You convinced the two sides to talk and find common ground. They were grateful for your insight and managed a dialogue.
You fought and lost and you were forced to flee, so you never did find out how the conflict ended.
Father's choice
You came across a small hamlet where a father was about to kill his cursed daughter.
But you decided to leave.
You killed the villagers and you decided to take on the cursed girl yourself, claiming you can handle it. Zloslava is now your problem, or blessing, depending on how fate will see it.
You killed the villagers and you decided to leave the girl behind.
You tried to kill the villagers, but failed and had to run away.
You assisted the father in cleansing the curse, he was very grateful to you that his daughter is now free, even if she is not alive.
You allowed the father to kill the cursed child and the villagers were grateful you did not interfere.
You tried to cleanse the curse from the child, but failed to do it properly and so the child became a wraith.
Sea Heaven
You came across a shipwreck with a female floating atop a raft, clutching a golden treasure chest. She called out for help.
But you decided to ignore her.
But a kraken devoured her and you did not pursue.

She told you of the treasure chest and how it must be taken to her home, or else her people will suffer. But a kraken devoured her. You decided to try and track the beast to see if you can help and you think you can find where it went once you land on the shore.
But a kraken devoured her and you could not pursue.
You found the kraken who kidnaped a girl at sea.
You spotted the kraken's hideout in a cave nearby.
You stole the chest from the kraken when he was busy with the girl, and you were able to recover some loot.
You stole the chest from the kraken when he was busy with the girl, and you decided to carry it back to her home as she begged you to do. The location should become visible to you as you get closer.

You killed the kraken and rescued the girl, but she was weak and said she could only be healed in her home. You decided to carry her and the chest back to this home as she begged you to do. The location should become visible to you as you get closer.
You killed the kraken and rescued the girl, but she was weak and said she could only be healed in her home. But you decided to abandon her and take the chest.
The kraken beat you and chased you away. You were not able to find the cave again.
But you decided to ignore her.
You found the refuge of the water demons.
They were happy you honoured their friend's request, and so you gained their friendship.
Someone stalked your camp at night.
One of your magic users is gone! Try to search for the kidnapper.
You found the tower of Koshei, where he took your wise one.

It turned out the Koshei is an immortal being. He needs a witch's life essence for his rituals and so he was not willing to give up his prey. You must try to search for help if you hope to rescue your friend.
You found a witch that knows Koshei.
She proved to be the man's ex, and so she agreed to tell you of a way t kill the immortal. You must search for a chest, where he locked his life away.

She proved to be the man's ex, but was not willing to help in hurting him. Instead, she told you of another witch you may capture and exchange for your friend. She marked the location of the rival witch on your map.
You tried to capture the witch to exchange for your friend, but that only angered Koshei. All chance of reclaiming your lost one is gone.
You found the grove where you sought the aid of the divine against Koshei.
The gods were clearly angry with the ancient mage's defiance and thus they gave you the power to smite him. Go look for his tower again.
The gods were clearly angry with the ancient mage's defiance, but you failed their test and thus not only felt the displeasure of the divine, but also lost your friend for good.
You tracked down the witch whom you must capture and exchange for your kidnapped friend.
The witch proved to be honourable and good and she agreed to lay down her life for that of your friend. You accepted her sacrifice.
The witch proved to be honourable and good and she agreed to lay down her life for that of your friend. You declined her sacrifice and accepted the fate of your friend.
You captured her and must now find the Koshei again.
You found the tree where Koshei's life was hidden.
You unlocked the chest and destroyed what was within, thus ending the unnatural life of the Koshei and rescuing your friend.
The bunny man
You came across an odd fella in distress.
He begged you to find his lost bunny and you agreed.
He begged you to find his lost bunny but you killed the crazy man instead.
He begged you to find his lost bunny but you decided to just leave.
You tracked the bunny's possible location.

You discovered a pack of wolves, desperate for you to take the bunny away as they say it is a cursed creature and who try catching it die. You eventually managed to get the little bugger. Better go find the bunny man.

You discovered a pack of wolves, desperate for you to take the bunny away as they say it is a cursed creature and who try catching it die. They were right, the little shit kept hurting you, so you gave up and abandoned the quest.

You discovered a pack of wolves, desperate for you to take the bunny away as they say it is a cursed creature and who try catching it die. They were right, the little shit kept hurting you, so you killed it.
You tracked the bunny's possible location.

The bunny was long dead and used as ornament for some rusalkas who served an old man. You freed the rusalkas, but that did mean no bunny. They gave you a bunny goat instead, so you can find the bunny man and try to trick him.

The bunny was long dead and used as ornament for some rusalkas who served an old man. The man, Huffmir, sold you a bunny goat, and swore it is just like a bunny. Find the bunny man and try to trick him.
You failed to retrieve a bunny.
You returned the bunny to Tobiasz.
And you found a group of knights trying to get past the bunny to get into a cave. It was not easy, but you got the furry critter and can go look for the bunny man and his reward now.
And you found a group of knights trying to get past the bunny to get into a cave. You failed to retrieve the bunny.
You found the bunny man again.
You returned the bunny-goat to Tobiasz and he accepted it.
You returned the bunny-goat to Tobiasz be he did not buy it and left.
Dwarf baker
You found a house of a dwarf baker.
The baker was having some trouble with a nasty spirit haunting his oven. He asked you to bring him a lump of stone he thinks the spirit came from, so that it may be destroyed. You agreed.
The baker was having some trouble with a nasty spirit haunting his oven. You dealt with the spirit for him.
The baker was having some trouble with a nasty spirit haunting his oven. You tried banishing the spirit but failed and so you had to leave quickly before the dwarf took his anger out on you.
The baker was having some trouble with a nasty spirit haunting his oven. You dealt with the spirit, but your ritual destroyed the oven, so you had to leave quickly.
The baker was having some trouble with a nasty spirit haunting his oven, but you decided to side with the spirit and attacked the dwarf. You killed him and left.

The baker was having some trouble with a nasty spirit haunting his oven, but you decided to side with the spirit and attacked the dwarf. You killed him and agreed to help the spirit by taking it back to its original dwelling. The ghost marked it on your map.
The baker was having some trouble with a nasty spirit haunting his oven, but you decided to side with the spirit and attacked the dwarf. He beat you and you had to run.
You dealt with the spirit by returning the stone it was bound to and the dwarf was very grateful to you.
You find the small quarry where the dwarf baker sent you.
You discovered the stone that is linked with the spirit haunting the dwarven baker's oven. Time to return it to him.
You find the small quarry where the ghost sent you.
You reunite the spirit with the stone it was originally bound to.
You fail to uncover the stone that originally held the spirit and the ghost perishes.
You found a goldfish.
You helped her and she told you of a location for hidden treasure in some old castle ruins.
You helped her and she told you of a location for hidden treasure in some old castle ruins and she tipped you to sing a lullaby if you encounter a child ghost on your way.
The fish was dying and you demanded a reward for saving it from her sister. The sister agreed and threw in a location of some treasure.
You found the castle ruins.
And explored its depths as much as it was possible.
But all you find is some angry ghosts. You did uncover another treasure trail though, maybe you will have more luck there.
But all you find is some angry ghosts.
You found the remains of some old village, where you were supposed to find a treasure.
It was a dormant place of power and you were able to unravel its mysteries.
It was a dormant place of power and you were not able to unravel its mysteries.
Goblin killer
You came across some goblins who asked you for help as they were being chased by a goblin killer.
You realised they were not truthfull and when confronted, they told you it was them who murdered the man's village in the first place. You left them to their fate.
You agreed to track down the man who is chasing them.

You realised they were not truthfull and when confronted, they told you it was them who murdered the man's village in the first place. Reluctantly, you still agreddd to search for the man and try to help them.
You did not want to get involved.
You killed the goblins and left.
Your paths crossed with the goblin killer.
You chose to avoid confrontation and left.
You killed the notorious brute and many goblins sent you gifts in thanks.
He and his band were adamant all goblins must die, seeing as you weree not their prey, they left to track down their target.
You tried to kill them, but you were beaten instead.
You convinced the goblin killer and one way or another, convinced them not to pursue the goblins.
You were forced to run away.
You helped them to track down the goblins and they were grateful.
